CatDescriptText: Mainway Market was formerly Podolsky Brothers. Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 29, 1960, pg. 2, reads: "Mingling with the Crowd - Vice President Nixon ignored the advice of aides last Monday night by getting out of his car to mingle with a crowd which had braved cold weather to get a look at the Republican candidate for President. An estimated 300 or more citizens assembled in front of the headquarters of Democrats and Independents for Nixon - Lodge, 2035 Centre Ave. It was the only stop in Hill District, and Mr. Nixon insisted that it be made, prior to proceeding to Syria Mosque where he addressed a capacity crowd. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Richard Nixon speaking in crowd, for 1960 presidential campaign, in front of Stop and Shop Mainway Market on Centre Avenue, across from Erin Street, Hill District
